result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:06 PM Defendant Cory J. Borgwardt not in court.  Attorney Luke K Harrison in court for Cory J. Borgwardt.  Prosecuting attorney Marconi De Franca Barros in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
The defendant fails to appear for today's initial appearance.
The Court authorizes a warrant for the defendant.
Defendant is to be denied by Public Defender for special bail appearance and must report to the jail for booking.
DEFENDANT IS TO BE REMANDED TO THE JAIL. DEFENDANT IS TO BE DENIED BY PUBLIC DEFENDER FOR SPECIAL BAIL APPEARANCE. DEFENDANT MUST REPORT IMMEDIATELY TO THE JAIL FOR BOOKING.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 10-24-22 at 1:30 pm in Branch 1.  Previously furnished recognizance bond is continued with all prior conditions.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.

Minutes.
Warrant canceled and original returned to Clerk's office.
Initial appearance on September 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:27 pm - Defendant Cory J.  Borgwardt not in court.  Attorney Carl Knepel in court for Atty. Luke Harrison.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. State requests warrant.  Court authorizes warrant.
RE:  Possess Fentanyl-2nd and subsequent offense, on 08-22-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of possess Fentanyl.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 09-19-22 at 1:30 pm. Br. 3.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol and drugs.  Bail furnished and defendant is remanded into custody on PO hold.   Court orders photos and prints at TRPD.
Minutes.
